analysis: The documents primarily concern the establishment, modification, and administration of boards, committees, and councils related to labor, industry, and economic recovery, particularly during the era of the National Industrial Recovery Act. They cover a range of topics including fair competition codes, labor disputes, wage and hour regulations, and the coordination of government activities. The sentiment is generally positive, focusing on promoting economic stability, fair labor practices, and cooperation between government, industry, and labor.
title: Labor, Industry, and Economic Recovery Boards and Committees
